summary: Robert B. Olsen was a Commission staff member involved in taking depositions related to the JFK assassination investigation. He is specifically mentioned as being involved in the deposition of Frank Sturgis and Wilfredo Navarro on April 4, 1975, concerning potential CIA involvement in assassination plots. The documents suggest Olsen's role was primarily focused on gathering information through depositions from individuals who may have had connections to the CIA and potential assassination attempts, particularly those related to Fidel Castro and Cuban officials. There is no specific timeline of involvement provided beyond his participation in the April 1975 depositions.
significance: Robert B. Olsen's significance lies in his role as a Commission staff member actively involved in taking depositions from key individuals, such as Frank Sturgis, who were potentially connected to CIA activities and assassination plots. His work contributed to the investigation of possible CIA involvement in the JFK assassination and related events.
